name: places/ChIJtdyYI75YwokRQxfXVVboUxY
formattedAddress: 1142 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1142 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10075-0307, USA

originalText.text: Do not waste your time with this company.  I ordered Visbiome and they sent it in a small package with a small icepack (See photo).  The bottle Temp was almost 91 degrees!  I emailed them about this and got a rather cocky response from Nathan which read, "The product is perfectly fine it can stay outside of the fridge up two weeks in room temperature as stated by the Manufacture website".  The pure lack of knowledge from eisler chemist is a joke.  The Visboime website says temperature spikes over 86 degrees degrades the bacteria. I emailed that to Nathan.  He replied that he would send me a return label to return the product, and he would ship a new one to me.  He never did.  After a long delay I emailed NATHAN and asked where my product was.  He replied he refunded me.  Then I saw a refund in my email a few minutes later.  You have to wonder if someone ordering that product is going to get the same damaged product that I returned.  Stay away from this place.  HORRIBLE customer service, lack of knowledge and clearly dishonest!

originalText.text: Old school personable pharmacy and staff! They know all of their customers by name and provide wholehearted, individualized care to each and every person!

text.text: Old school personable pharmacy and staff! They know all of their customers by name and provide wholehearted, individualized care to each and every person!

originalText.text: So reliable, caring, and honest. You are family there. Yesterday I went in to buy a product and the fellow working there suggested a home remedy for the problem I was having, warmly steering me away from buying something that would be less effective. I left the store having spent no money but with the knowledge I needed for a cure. They are always so helpful and the products are great.

originalText.text: Great old school pharmacy with great availability of prescriptions

text.text: Great old school pharmacy with great availability of prescriptions

originalText.text: Attempted to put in a verbal order for a patient as my electronic medical record system was down. He asked me what the medication was for. After learning what the medications were, it was decided that he will not fill the medication. I am sorry, but you do not make the determination if the medication is necessary for the patient or not. These were generic/ non-controlled substance medication. The two individuals whom i spoke with on 2/13/2023 said it is not possible to take a verbal order and hung up. This is quite disappointing and an incredible inconvenience for the patient.
